subject: Re: [junit] JUnit4TestAdapter issue when using the IntelliJ IDEA 4 testrunner
msgSnippet: Chris, No immediate help, but two questions: 1) I believe that IDEA 7 is out.  Have you tried an evaluation version to see if upgrading resolves the problem?
messageBody:
Chris,

No immediate help, but two questions:

1) I believe that IDEA 7 is out. Have you tried an evaluation version
to see if upgrading resolves the problem?
2) Do you have the backtrace of the exception?

Thanks,

David Saff

On Nov 15, 2007 8:39 PM, Chris Barham <cbarham@...> wrote:
> Hi,
> The following test works fine on Eclipse with the old style jUnit 3
> testrunner, but when run with IntelliJ IDEA version 4's testrunner it
> blows up with a ClassCastException. Can
> anyone give advice on how to resolve this, as the official IDE at my
> workplace is IntelliJ IDEA version 4, and this will slow jUnit 4.4
> adoption :-(
>
> ---------------------------------
> public class UnderTest {
> public boolean tickleIt() {
> return true;
> }
> }
> ----------------------------------
> import static org.junit.Assert.assertTrue;
> import junit.framework.JUnit4TestAdapter;
>
> import org.junit.Before;
> import org.junit.Test;
>
> public class TestUnderTest extends UnderTest { // can now insert test
> Spy or self shunt
>
> public static junit.framework.Test suite() {
> return new JUnit4TestAdapter(TestUnderTest.class);
> }
>
> @Before
> public void setUp() {
> // no-op
> }
>
> @Test
> public void testTickleIt() {
> assertTrue(tickleIt());
> }
> }
>
>
> Many Thanks,
> Chris
